title: Figma Launches Three AI-Powered Image Editing Tools to Streamline Designer Workflows

paragraphs.content: Figma unveiled three new AI-driven image editing tools on December 10, 2025, designed to eliminate the need for designers to switch between multiple applications.The **Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image** features enable precise edits directly within Figma Design and Figma Draw, reducing friction in creative workflows.These tools are now available to users on Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled, with a broader rollout across Figma's platform planned for 2026.The launch represents a significant step as Figma moves to match capabilities long offered by rivals such as Adobe and Canva.

paragraphs.content: Figma consolidated these new features into a unified image editing toolbar alongside existing tools like background removal and cropping, making powerful editing functions immediately accessible on the canvas.According to Figma's analysis, background removal is the most frequently used AI action on the platform, which motivated the company to expand its image editing toolkit and give this feature prominent placement in the new toolbar.The tools require no text prompts, instead prioritizing granular control through visual selection methodsâ€”a deliberate design choice that sets them apart from generative models.This approach reflects Figma's understanding that designers need both creative generation capabilities and precise refinement controls to achieve professional results.

sections.title: Three Core Capabilities: Object Removal, Isolation, and Image Expansion

paragraphs.content: The **Erase object** tool uses an upgraded lasso selection method to remove unwanted elements from images while preserving surrounding context.When designers select and delete an object, AI intelligently fills in the background, maintaining details like lighting, shadows, and color consistency.This eliminates the common workflow interruption of exporting images to external editors like Photoshop, making cleanup work faster and more intuitive directly within the design file.The lasso-based approach provides visual feedback and control, allowing designers to refine selections before committing to edits.

paragraphs.content: The **Isolate object** feature allows designers to select a specific subject and reposition it independently without affecting the surrounding image.Once isolated, users can apply targeted adjustments including blur, color correction, desaturation, and shadow effects to individual elements.For example, in product photography, a designer might brighten key components while desaturating the background to draw attention to featured items.The **Expand image** tool addresses a persistent design challenge by extending backgrounds to fit new aspect ratios without distortion or cropping.Converting a square 1x1 product image into a landscape web banner now preserves the original subject while intelligently filling background areas, eliminating the need for constant cropping and reframing.

paragraphs.content: Technology publications widely praised Figma's update for streamlining creative workflows and reducing tool-switching friction for UI/UX designers, marketers, and product teams.TechCrunch positioned the launch as Figma catching up to established rivals, noting that Adobe and Canva have offered object removal capabilities for several years.However, reviewers highlighted Figma's in-canvas integration as a meaningful advantage, allowing teams to complete editing tasks without the export-and-reimport workflow that disrupts creative momentum.The launch coincided with Adobe integrating similar image editing features into ChatGPT, where Figma serves as a launch partner, though integration details between the platforms remain unclear.

paragraphs.content: Industry analysts emphasize workflow efficiency gains beyond individual design tasks, particularly for cross-functional teams and marketing departments.The consolidated toolbar reduces cognitive load by centralizing frequently used functions, enabling faster turnaround on campaign mockups and test variations.Broader implications include reduced dependency on specialized design teams for routine image cleanups, empowering stakeholders to make on-the-fly edits during review cycles.With planned expansions in 2026, including potential video editing capabilities, these tools represent Figma's broader strategy to position itself as a comprehensive creative platform rather than solely a design and prototyping tool.
